intro: Melandrium apricum var. firmum, commonly known as the common honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, round, white fruits that resemble tiny pearls. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and woodland edges. The species is known for its short growing season and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
